meanings.definition: Organisms that produce their own food through photosynthesis or chemosynthesis.
meanings.sent1: Autotrophs are plants that make their own food using sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study autotrophs to understand how they create energy from the sun.
meanings.sent3: The autotrophs at the bottom of the ocean throw a party every time they make a new batch of food.
meanings.sent4: In the ecosystem, autotrophs act as the chefs, preparing meals for other organisms.
meanings.sent5: Autotrophs are like self-sustaining kitchens, always cooking up their next meal.

meanings.definition: An organism that is able to synthesize its own food from inorganic substances.
meanings.sent1: Autotrophs can turn simple minerals into complex nutrients for themselves.
meanings.sent2: The soil is full of autotrophs that work hard to create their own sustenance.
meanings.sent3: The autotrophs in the laboratory were so skilled, they could turn rocks into a gourmet meal.
meanings.sent4: In a barren land, autotrophs are like alchemists, transforming basic elements into life-giving sustenance.
meanings.sent5: Autotrophs are like magical chefs, conjuring up meals from the most unlikely ingredients.
